short_summary: Request for Proposal: Passenger Vessel for Hire by Conservation and Protection for Patrols in waters adjacent to western Cape Breton N.S.
description: The Fisheries and Oceans Department is seeking bids for a fishing vessel to perform the following services: \\- Hauling of mainly snow crab traps, lobster traps, rock crab traps, gill nets, long lines, and other types of fishing gear and apparatuses. \\- Conducting mainly mid-shore patrols in snow crab fishery but also sporadic coastal patrols in lobster, rock crab, herring, recreational mackerel, striped bass, tuna, groundfish fisheries, and others as required. \\- Using a vessel with a deck space large enough to accommodate stacking of at least 25 crab traps or 50 lobster traps. \\- Ensuring the vessel has a minimum required speed of 8 knots and be able to maintain a cruising speed of 8 knots or above for a prolonged period of time, unloaded. \\- Having an acceptable lavatory facility and at least one 110v outlet available to Fishery Officers.

**Government of Canada Tender Notice**

* **Title (English):** Passenger Vessel for Hire by Fisheries and Oceans Canada for Patrols in Waters Adjacent to Western Cape Breton, Nova Scotia
* **Title (French):** Bateau à Passagers Loué par Pêches et Océans Canada pour les Patrouilles dans les Eaux Adjacentes à l'Ouest du Cap-Breton (N.-É.)
* **Reference Number:** cb-5882-16636246
* **Amendment Number:** 5
* **Solicitation Number:** 30004106B
* **Publication Date:** May 25, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** June 6, 2023, 13:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** June 7, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** June 30, 2023
* **Tender Status:** Expired

**Notice Details**

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites interested parties to submit proposals for the hire of a passenger vessel for patrols in waters adjacent to Western Cape Breton, Nova Scotia. The selected vessel must meet specific requirements, including:

* Overall length: 40 to 44 feet
* Service of a captain and two crew members
* Ability to conduct gear inspections and patrols with a Fishery Officer on board
* Hauling of various types of fishing gear and apparatuses
* Conducting mid-shore patrols in Snow Crab fishery and coastal patrols in other fisheries, as required

The vessel must also meet the following technical requirements:

* Deck space capable of accommodating a minimum of 25 crab traps or 50 lobster traps
* Minimum required speed of 8 knots and ability to maintain a cruising speed of 8 knots or above
* Acceptable lavatory facility
* At least one 110V outlet available to Fishery Officers

* Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* Phone: (506) 429-2397
